##Wuhan goods and materials are in short supply. How hard is it for civilian forces to send aid to a hospital?

Health insight

Functional introduction, understand the health professional news

* On June 1, a company specializing in medicine distribution began helping the Wuhan Red Cross deal with the aid that had accumulated in its warehouses. The state of disorder has greatly improved.
* August 23, Wuhan, "City" since the hospital protection materials in emergency, a variety of non-governmental forces in response.
* The USTC and the Wuhan University, in a joint effort across the Pacific, sent 2.5 tons of face masks, isolation suits and other supplies to Concorde in Wuhan.
* The person in charge of foreign-funded medical instrument companies in Hubei acts as a volunteer to coordinate the docking of donated materials.
* More and more non-governmental public welfare organizations, choose their own package, materials directly sent to the recipient units to improve efficiency, in the Red Cross or charity is only registered for the record.

On Feb. 1, a company specializing in medicine distribution began helping the Wuhan Red Cross to dispose of aid that had accumulated in its warehouses. The state of disorder has greatly improved.

January 23, Wuhan, "closed" since the hospital protection materials, a variety of civil forces in response.

The North Carolina Alumni Association of HUST and Wuhan University, in a joint effort across the Pacific, delivered 2.5 tons of face masks, isolation suits and other supplies to Concorde in Wuhan.

The head of a foreign medical device company in Hubei Province serves as a volunteer coordinating the docking of donated supplies.

More and more non-governmental public welfare organizations, choose their own package, materials directly sent to the recipient units to improve efficiency, in the Red Cross Society or charity is only registered for the record.

At noon on Feb. 1, the Wuhan Red Cross Temporary Warehouse, a collection of aid from far and wide, was a sea change from the chaos and disorder seen in previous news videos.

Four medical logistics professionals from Kyushu Tong, together with staff from the Wuhan Red Cross, Wuhan Municipal Health and Health Commission and the Wuhan Market Supervision and Administration Bureau, are responsible for directing and dispatching warehouse staff on a round-the-clock basis.

On February 1, the Wuhan New Crown Pneumonia Prevention and control headquarters assigned Jiuzhoutong Medical Group to assist the Red Cross in handling materials. Kyushu Tong is a professional distribution and distribution of medicine listed companies, headquartered in Wuhan.

The goods and materials stored in the warehouse are either donated in a targeted way or not. Previously, targeted and non-targeted donations have been exposed when doctors come in with a full set of documents and come back empty-handed. On the one hand, hospitals are in urgent need of materials, have to the outside world for help; on the other hand, the Red Cross warehouse material backlog, circulation is not smooth.

With Kyushu's participation, a concerted effort was made to empty the warehouse, which was the size of two football fields. At eight o'clock, Jianwen saw on the spot that the doctors who had come to collect the materials lined up with letters of introduction and the receipt of the goods, handed them to the staff of the warehouse, and then went in with the staff to retrieve the materials.

At the same time, the unified control of the express delivery channel has also been loosened. Originally from January 29, the Green Channel opened by SF & Fung to Wuhan no longer accepts individual business, and the social donation channel to the hospital has been closed. By the evening of January 31, the two logistics companies, Shunfeng and Jingdong, held an emergency internal meeting and adjusted that from February 1, goods sent from nine cities, including Beijing, Shanghai and Guangzhou, to Wuhan could be ordered online, materials will be delivered directly to the designated units without Red Cross Transit.

The background of these changes is the inefficiency of the Wuhan Red Cross Society in receiving and distributing aid, which has attracted widespread public criticism. The involvement of professional social forces has clearly helped to ease the situation.

In fact, despite the difficulties, various social and non-governmental forces have been full of enthusiasm, trying to provide assistance for the Hubei anti-epidemic front.

In the face of a major crisis such as the new coronavirus epidemic, in the supply of goods and materials, both official organizations and non-governmental forces display their respective strengths and work together to optimize the allocation of resources, thus for the first-line "combat" medical personnel to provide adequate backup support.

The relay across the Pacific

January 23, Wuhan "closed city" that day, Wuhan major hospitals have to the community for help: Urgent Protection Materials. Including the Frontline Hospital of Wuhan Union Hospital.

Zhang Xin (not her real name) , who was in northern California, saw the donation information of Concorde Hospital for the first time. He graduated from Huazhong University of Science and Technology, and Wuhan is a city he remembers for at least four years. That night, he attended an emergency conference call with the North Carolina Alumni Association of Huake to discuss relief plans. On the other hand, alumni as far away as Wuhan University in Silicon Valley receive calls from Direct Relief seeking donations. Dr Is one of the largest international relief organizations in the US, having donated large quantities of relief materials in the 2008 earthquake in Wenchuan County.

A day later, Khuako and the North Carolina Alumni Association of both universities formed Wuhanunited.org  , a group of more than 20 members responsible for targeted donations to Wuhan Union. Gong Yitao, founder of the smart business community and a graduate of Khuako, was the overall commander of the operation.

Dr's donation, which included 200,000 surgical masks, 27,500 pairs of gloves and 4,000 isolation suits, weighed 2.5 tonnes. A few of the alumni doctors had deliberately cleared the list of non-medical products. This may seem like a small detail, but it's one that many donors tend to overlook. Not Conforming to the specifications of materials not only useless, but also cause the waste of human and material resources.

On January 25th the situation became more dire, but gong delivered good news -- two days later, a Fedex cargo plane took off from California to deliver free supplies to Wuhan. The problem is, the donor paperwork hasn't been finalized yet. They had to race against time to get the paperwork done before the supplies left.

For the next 36 hours, Li Wenquan, a member of the Wuhan University, was in charge of clearing the goods at the Guangzhou Customs. He believes the team has accomplished an "impossible" task.

Dr and Wuhan Xiehe signed the donation agreement, confirmed through the Hubei Charity Federation Channel Through Customs. They weighed the Wuhan Red Cross Society against the Hubei Charity Federation and chose the latter, Li said. Dr Has Professional Experience in material assistance, and later experience shows that they adhere to two principles, in the completion of the mission played a crucial role. One is only in the charity general record, insisted on not entering the warehouse; the other is insisted on customs clearance when not to open the package.

Donation materials to be approved by the Hubei Charity Federation, the need to provide the corresponding import documents, donors information, the number of goods varieties. The review took a few hours, but it went better than expected. At 3 p.m. on January 27, supplies for the Wuhan Union Hospital left the Dr's warehouse for the airport.

However, at this time through the customs formalities have not been completed. They have to go through customs within 21 hours from the truck to the airport to the cargo crossing the Pacific. "We connected with the Hubei Federation of Overseas Chinese and the Hubei Charity Federation, got the approval from the Hubei Charity Federation, and passed all the customs clearance documents to the fedex China team, " said Zhang Xin, adding that all the work was simple, however, the Hubei Charity Federation to the Information, how to amend, how to stamp, there are many small issues to deal with. "Late at night, people are on conference calls to discuss solutions to problems, and the North American head of the university sleeps almost four hours a day. "

The plane arrived in Guangzhou on January 29. Coming up, customs clearance. The Postal Service is willing to transport the goods free of charge, but according to the regulations, must be 100% real name, 100% out of the box inspection, 100% x-ray detection. In view of the risk of contamination, damage and even omission, the donor did not agree to the inspection and requested that the original packaging be sent to Concord Hospital.

The result was a special postal service with a green channel. But the whole process of communication can not be done by one person. For Lai, co-ordination is crucial. In particular, the system within the unit, the need to step-by-step reporting. The good news is that teamwork works.

After the material passes through customs, whether the special vehicle delivers Wuhan also once to have the dispute. Some people think it must be delivered by special bus. But the reality is that it is not cost-effective to transport only one or two tons of cargo. And after the driver goes, there's a 14-day quarantine. Finally, at 10 p.m. on Jan. 30, a postal EMS truck left Guangzhou for Wuhan.

On the afternoon of January 31, the supplies were successfully delivered to doctors and nurses in Xiehe, Wuhan. At this point, a relay across the Pacific Ocean, is the end.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
 Picture Source: CAAC. Net

Procurement and logistics are fraught with difficulties

Khuako and the Wuhan Alumni Association's Trans Oceanic relay is a microcosm of the many types of nongovernmental organizations involved in helping Wuhan.

Soon after the new crown outbreak, many active domestic foundations found that much-needed medical supplies were soon not available on the domestic market. According to the Ministry of Industry and Information Technology's previous statistics, the maximum production capacity of medical masks is 20 million per day, less than 10,000 protective clothing per day.

Li Dalin, Secretary General of the Medical Branch of the Wuhan University in Beijing, told people that they used to call almost every company in a national medical supply catalogue, over the next few days, the response was that most of them were already connected to the government, and could sell them less than 10 percent of their total output.

Some resellers, who have stock in hand, are harder to win over. Li Dalin once met a businessman who sold N95 masks. The market price was 6 yuan. He quoted 70 yuan. "They don't care if you're a front-line hospital. You don't want it. People want it. "

Many domestic non-profit organizations have to shop overseas.

Huaxia commonweal first set up the global supplies group, which is headquartered in Hangzhou, while Zhejiang has a large number of overseas Chinese resources, so it organized overseas Chinese volunteers scattered around the world. Subsequently, a group of imported medical device manufacturers and a medical device identification group were set up to assist overseas Chinese in purchasing medical supplies that meet the requirements in the wechat group. But these are not enough, so also included Yiwu International e-commerce platform and the world's Zhejiang Chamber of Commerce. Efforts were mobilized to procure 200,000 N95 masks, 1 million surgical masks and 50,000 protective clothing.

The biggest difficulty in overseas procurement is customs clearance. Zheng Yilou, deputy secretary-general of the Zhejiang Charity Federation and head of the Huaxia Public Welfare, told the 8 o'clock news that Huaxia Public Welfare can gather hundreds of people to support it at various points in the process, but customs clearance is the responsibility of a semi-official group, there's only four people running it at the moment. "I have to go through customs until 2 am every night. It's a weak link, but I've been there day and night to help. "

As Infectious Disease Prevention and control on transport restrictions, the delivery of goods is also difficult.

Zhou Jun (not his real name) is the head of a foreign medical device company in Hubei Province. On January 23, after Wuhan was "closed to the city, " he was isolated at home when he read online that an overseas fund company wanted to donate materials to more than a dozen designated hospitals in Wuhan. At that time, the other party has purchased more than 100 million yuan worth of masks, protective clothing and other medical supplies, is worried about how to distribute in Wuhan.

Relying on his long-standing connections, Zhou Jun found a local pharmaceutical company in Wuhan for the Foundation, and successfully took on the task of transporting supplies from the airport and distributing them to various hospitals, because the drug companies themselves have GSP certified warehouses, as well as manpower and transport vehicles, things are going well.

Because this matter has the sense of accomplishment Zhou Jun, simply do a volunteer, in charge of docking various non-governmental organizations to Hubei donated materials. He handled by the largest amount of materials, from a chemical enterprise in Anhui more than 500 tons of high-concentration hydrogen peroxide. He distributed the goods to hospitals, schools and communities in more than a dozen cities, including Wuhan, Xiaogan, Huanggang, Ensch and Jingmen. "I'm a medical man myself. High levels of hydrogen peroxide are very useful in hospitals and can be diluted and used to kill in urban environments. "

Since the spread of the new Crown Disease in Wuhan, the inefficient operation of Wuhan Red Cross and other organizations has seriously slowed down the pace of supplies and caused unnecessary troubles to the first-line medical staff.

"In fact, we can totally take the road of non-governmental public welfare organizations. " Zhou Jun told the eight-point health news that there are two modes of donation by non-governmental public welfare organizations. One is only responsible for fund-raising and material procurement, gIVE THE ITEM to the local Red Cross or charity society, who will distribute it for the last kilometer. The other is a non-governmental organization that does the whole thing, but needs to register it with the Red Cross or charity society.

"Now more and more non-governmental organizations are choosing the second model, " said Zhou, whose job is to find local organizations with transport capacity for non-governmental goods, such as medical distribution companies, in Hubei Province, let's say a rescue team, and have them take things from an airport or a highway to the city for distribution. "A day and a half at the most, I'm sure we can get it to the hospital. "

As one of the largest non-governmental organizations in China, one foundation has also adopted the Red Cross registration model. As can be seen from the official website of the one foundation, the materials of the one foundation supporting Wuhan are mainly coordinated by the Wuhan Yunbao Rescue Team, and distributed in other areas of Hubei Province, more than 40 agencies in Hubei are working together under the one foundation's joint disaster relief project. On Feb. 1, one foundation distributed 157000 face masks and 12,800 protective glasses to cities in Hubei Province. Also arriving on the same day were 990 walkie-talkies and 500 protective clothing, which were also scheduled to arrive at the hospital the next day.

"We now have several people coordinating the matching of these materials at the same time, " said Zhou, who has been involved in the distribution of materials from several foundations. Hundreds of groups have been added in recent days, including companies or individuals who are interested in donating, they are responsible for communicating what the provider can provide and matching it to the hospital in need. "I can only sleep for three or four hours a day. There's too much information to read. Several donors don't even know their real names because they don't have time to change their notes. "

Wuhan's peripheral cities are more difficult

In recent days, as the epidemic spread and traffic control escalated, Zhou Jun clearly felt that the ability to deploy more and more tight transport capacity.

"A few days ago, a plane that evacuated overseas Chinese brought some medical supplies. It took me more than an hour just to coordinate the transportation of these supplies from the airport to the city, " Zhou said, the city's bus resources are tight, not to mention the drivers who can drive the bus. According to the rules, any driver who had delivered supplies to a nearby city would be quarantined for 14 days upon return, which meant one less driver for each long trip.

In addition, with the increasing amount of outside donations, such as Shunfeng, debang, Jd.com and other large logistics companies have joined the Public Welfare transport organized by the government, it is difficult to take into account the civilian side.

Zhou also gave another example from the other day. He was approached by an entrepreneur in Wuhan who wanted to co-ordinate a shipment of supplies to Ensch. The plan was to find a car in Wuhan to take the goods to the expressway and have Ensch send a car for them. As a result, Enshi to the car waiting for four hours at the highway entrance, they have not coordinated to get things out of the cart.

At that time, Zhou Jun cried.

In most news reports, Wuhan was at the center of the outbreak, so supplies from home and abroad poured into the city. But in fact, Huanggang, Xiaogan and Xiangyang Around Wuhan took on a large number of Wuhan's overflow population before the city was shut down. These three cities rank among the top outside Wuhan in the number of newly diagnosed cases, that's over 3,000 people.

The need for medical supplies in these places is even more pressing than in Wuhan. The director of a hospital in Xiangyang, Hubei Province, told Jianwen at 8:00 a.m. that since the admission of new crown patients, the hospital's reserves have almost dried up, and even the amount of disinfectant is only one day's use. "But even if all the protection is gone, the patient will come, it is an order, it is a duty. "

Zhou Jun said, "What we are thinking now is that we hope that the headquarters of these prefectures and cities can co-ordinate, for example, by integrating the local pharmaceutical and logistics companies and sending them to Wuhan to tow the supplies back, provided of course that the Red Cross agrees. "

How can civilian forces be used when one side is in trouble and the other side is in need?

The battle against the new outbreak has lasted more than 10 days, starting with the January 23 siege of Wuhan.

Since the start of the campaign, the Hubei and Wuhan Red Cross Societies, which had the right to receive donations, have come under pressure for failing to deliver resources to frontline medical staff.

On the other hand, because of the monopoly of local Red Cross and other institutions to receive goods, so that some civil society organizations in the process of assistance are everywhere restricted. A staff member of a charitable foundation revealed that he once coordinated a donation. The company hired a car to deliver the materials to the designated hospital, but due to the inability to provide the certificate of qualification issued by the Red Cross Society, proved that the car's medical supplies meet the conditions of donation, the hospital leaders always dare not receive, finally the company responsible person had to turn around and leave.

Ma Jianyin, director of the Beijing Normal University, said in an interview with Sanlian life weekly that in theory, the Red Cross could lead the way to better donation efficiency, peer-to-peer giving by individuals or businesses is a less efficient form of giving. "This time, however, neither the donors nor the hospitals were satisfied with the efficiency of the coordination and deployment of supplies. "

Zheng 10 believes that in the face of an epidemic or disaster, official, semi-official and private forces should be able to go hand in hand, the three sides play their respective expertise. He cites the Ya'an earthquake of 2014, when local governments joined forces with quasi-governmental organizations like the Charity Federation and the Red Cross, as well as actively involved nongovernmental foundations, to form a Social Organization Service Center, to make the relief work very smooth.

Service Center is to provide a one-stop service platform to share the dynamic information of material demand, and then let the folk force to realize the peer-to-peer service on this basis. The private foundation is most worried about is similar to the Red Cross in a hurry. Point-to-point, so that the foundation can deliver the goods to the donors in a timely manner.

This time, the situation has taken a turn for the better as public opinion has grown. On February 1, the official website of the Wuhan Red Cross Society of the People's Republic of China (Wuhan Red Cross Society) released "thank you for your kindness in answering questions" : In order to further shorten the running time of donated materials, the Wuhan Red Cross Society has made appropriate adjustments to the targeted donation process, domestic and foreign units or individuals with directional donation hospitals can directly with the directional donation medical institutions docking, after confirmation of materials can be sent directly to the recipient units. If you need donation voucher, you can go through the donation procedure with the relevant certificate of the recipient unit at the later stage.

On the same day, Wuhan New Pneumonia Control Headquarters assigned jiuzhoutong medical group to assist the Red Cross in reloading supplies. As of press time, Kyushu Tong has completed the emergency materials sub-storage, classification code put.

"This is the best news I've heard in days. The government can finally use the professional power of the people, instead of putting all its efforts on the Red Cross, which has only a dozen people, " Zhou said.

Ma Jianyin also felt that this was a better way, "In such a special period, in fact, we should not limit the task of receiving donated materials to a few institutions according to the habit of thinking. We can consider special arrangements, integrate social forces, and open up private channels. "

By Mao Xiaoqiong, Tan Zhuo, Wu Jing

Liu Ran, Ji Minhua | managing editor
